titleStmt.title: Indecorum: or A briefe treatise vpon one of Salomons Prouerbs. Chap 11.22 Wherein is shewed, how ill-beseeming all common gifts and worldly blessings are to all such, as are not furnished with some answerable measure, of spirituall and sauing grace.
titleStmt.author: Egerton, Stephen, 1555?-1621?

titleStmt.title: Indecorum: or A briefe treatise vpon one of Salomons Prouerbs. Chap 11.22 Wherein is shewed, how ill-beseeming all common gifts and worldly blessings are to all such, as are not furnished with some answerable measure, of spirituall and sauing grace.
titleStmt.author: Egerton, Stephen, 1555?-1621?

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for Richard Boyle [and VVilliam Ihones], and are to be sould at his shop dwelling in the Blackefriers,

notesStmt.note: Heading of dedication, and "To the Christian reader" at end, signed: S.E., i.e. Stephen Egerton.
Running title reads: A briefe treatise vpon Prouerbs, 11.22.
Colophon reads: Printed at London by Felix Kingston for Richard Boyle, and VVilliam Ihones. 1613.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
